intro: Sesbania cassioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sesbania, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a legume belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It has a short life cycle, typically completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. Sesbania cassioides is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it valuable in soil enrichment and agroforestry systems.
